page.title: 01Caoles and the Isle of Gunna
page.content: This block includes the southernmost tip of the Isle of Coll in the Inner Hebrides plus the small island of Gunna. Apart from sea and coastal rock the vegitation comprises sand dune grasses as well as heath and moorland grasses over peat and rock. The vegitation of this small area is the single most important point of interest, as the sand dune bent grasses or Machair provide the cover for many small and rare flowers and plants which have persuaded the Nature Conservancy Council to designate the Caoles and Gunna areas as a site of special scientific interest. Seabirds, such as diving ducks and geese are given ideal breeding and feeding grounds round the shores, while inland sheep are farmed to utilise the fine grasses over the area.
